meanings.definition: A band or bundle of fibrous tissue in a human or animal body that has the ability to contract, producing movement in or maintaining the position of parts of the body.
meanings.sent1: Her leg muscle helped her run fast.
meanings.sent2: He felt sore in his muscles after the workout.
meanings.sent3: The muscle in the arm flexed proudly during the race.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the muscle that drove him to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The muscle's strength was evident as he lifted the heavy box.

meanings.sent1: The muscle of the team was their unity.
meanings.sent2: She used all her muscle to open the stubborn jar.
meanings.sent3: The muscle of the storm was felt in the powerful winds.
meanings.sent4: His words carried the muscle needed to inspire change.
meanings.sent5: The muscle of his argument convinced everyone in the room.
